Description: Lower body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery globular aryballos; exterior: black-figure decoration (fired brown) consisting of holpites marching right (legs of two warriors and shield with added red of one warrior remaining); hailstorm filling ornament; below, four narrow bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding marching warriors, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.127.2 and AN1896-1908-G.120.30.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 218)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 62, no. A35, pl. XLVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.131) (Phase 1)
